items.content:
Senior PHP Laravel Developer 

Healthy Back Institute

Are you a highly skilled and talented Full-stack Developer looking for a place where you can be on the leading edge of modern e-commerce?


Would you like to be a key part of team that is stable, here for the long-term, and has a proven track record of delivering high quality applications that run the core operations of a fast growing  ecommerce company?


My name is Ken Burge and I am CTO here at The Healthy Back InstituteÃ¢Â Â¦ we are leaders in the natural pain relief market and we help millions of people all over the world to live pain free naturally through our specialized supplements and training programs.


I am looking for a highly skilled and talented Senior Application Developer to join my team and help take us to the next level.


And yes, we really do have an incredible team of all-stars and an exciting, healthy and fun cultureÃ¢Â Â¦ and that's why once people come to work here they never want to leave. Check out our reviews on sites like GlassDoor and Indeed to see for yourself.


If you are motivated and excited by cutting edge technology and big challenges...then definitely keep readingÃ¢Â Â¦


POSITION OVERVIEW


This is full time, remote role and you will report directly to me while working closely with a small  team of developers that really enjoy working together. The right person will bring energy, passion, and a love for technology to the role.  We are looking for people who are curious, love creating solutions and get excited about new technology.


If selected for this role, you will be key player on our technology team and a major contributor to our internal e-commerce platform.  Our ecommerce platform processes all orders for our rapidly growing company, so knowledge and experience creating highly scalable applications is essential.


Everything we build is migrating to AWS so you will be working in a modern DevOps environment with continuous integration and continuous deployment capabilities with a true staging environment.


Responsibilities:  



* Act as lead developer on one of our main application modules as you build new capabilities with Laravel.

* Contributing to high-level architecture planning, consulting with our internal team on approach and level of effort, potentially directing more junior developers.

* Flexing your muscles on aspects of application development outside of app code: database modeling, query optimization, setting up efficient logging and monitoring solutions, and other advanced requirements for highly functioning apps (you do not need to be a DBA or SysAdmin).

* Working closely with our front-end development team on projects. We'll want and expect your input on the best ways to structure the build - from start to finish.

* Staying up-to-date on the latest development technologies and methodologies.





REQUIRED EXPERIENCE & TRAITS


Experience:   



* 5+ years of solid real-world experience building production-quality web applications.

* Strong application architecture skills, especially with high traffic websites.

* Laravel / PHP skills

* You should be able to talk in depth about a recent project where you used Laravel. I am looking for people who have used it in production for real projects and have solved hard problems with it.

* Experience working with AWS services is a plus.

* Working in a professional development team environment

* Experience using tools like Git / github.com and Jira.  





Personality Traits You Should Have



* Results focused - nuff said!

* Curious - strong desire to learn, especially new technology

* Optimizer - natural gift for identifying and solving problems quickly and effectively

* Resourceful - finds ways over, around or through barriers and challenges

* Driven - relentless, passionate, self-starter, super determined

* Team Player - approachable, cooperative and a good collaborator

* Responsible - truly have an ownership attitude

* Organized - effectively manage work / projects in multiple areas at the same time

* Great communicator - skilled listener, strong written and verbal communication

* Productive - great at managing your time, a strong starter and finisher

* Detail oriented - must have an eye for detail

* Growth oriented - you are always looking for ways to be and do better

* Witty - If you enjoy word play and arcane references to sci-fi then you'll fit right in.

* Tough - must be able thrive under pressure if the situation calls for it.





As you can see, I am very clear about the role, the responsibilities, the experience, skills and personality traits needed in order to be successful. If you feel you are a strong fit for the role, I definitely want to hear from you and encourage you to apply.


If you do not meet the required criteria but are interested in employment here, please check out our other open positions.


BENEFITS & PERKS



* Above average compensation

* Performance based bonuses

* PTO (up to 4 weeks per year)

* Medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance including HSA's

* FSA's and 401K plans

* Possible stock options

* Flexible schedules / work - life balance

* Paid professional development and continuing education

* Annual company meeting and retreat

* Paid travel

* Deep discounts on our products

* True rock-star, family like team





ABOUT US


he Healthy Back Institute is a publishing and consumer products business focused on helping people to "live without pain, naturally." Founded in 2003, it has quickly become one of the web's leading resources for people looking for information and products to help them find lasting relief.


Our company is a strong, stable and fast-growing business. Privately held, without any debt or outside investors to please, we do what we believe is best for the company, our team, our customers and the world.


Growing rapidly our team has gone from a small crew of 15 to over 65 in the past two years and we are on pace to surpass 100 within the next year or so.


We are a team of true "all-stars" who work and play hard. One of our core values is "Family" and our culture certainly represents that, with most team members having worked here an average of over 4 years.


Oh, and don't let the company name fool youÃ¢Â Â¦ we don't just help people with back pain, we help people with just about any type of pain to "live pain free naturally"... and are in the process of a major rebranding. Also, while we help our customers with their health we are a very high tech company.


Keywords:



* Full Stack Developer

* PHP

* Laravel

* Ecommerce Developer

* Application Developer

items.title: Zaengle: PHP / Laravel Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=52, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
PHP / Laravel Engineer

Company: Zaengle
Headquarters: Anywhere
Visit company website

We’re on the lookout for our next PHP / Laravel developer, could it be you? Our engineers help mission-driven organizations and forward-thinking companies build for the other side of the screen. They also contribute to the technical community through writing, building products, contributing to open-source, and public speaking (if that’s your thing). NO RECRUITERS OR AGENCIES PLEASE AND THANK YOU.

About Zaengle 

Zaengle is a technology company with a mission to Be Nice, Do Good on the web. We build websites, software, and digital products that empower organizations for greater impact. We're a 100% remote team across the US and UK. Each team member has a lot of autonomy and influence — this means we only hire folks who are highly motivated, accountable, and operate with integrity. You’ll be encouraged to develop creative solutions to problems, communicate and defend your ideas to clients, manage your responsibilities, and stay up-to-date on the latest best practices. If that sounds like you, read on!

We want to talk to you if you are:

  • Self-motivated. You don’t want to be micromanaged, or have your hand held. You don’t shy away from hard work, and always embrace new challenges.
  • Self-aware. You’re confident in your strengths and know what your weaknesses are. These don’t discourage you, rather, they make you even stronger.
  • Honest. You aren’t perfect, and neither are we. Integrity, honesty, and humility are hallmarks of your life.
  • Generous. You love helping others, sharing your expertise, and creatively giving back.
  • A genuine communicator. When you talk to clients, or your teammates, you’re clear, to the point, confident, and genuine.
  • A learner. When you don’t know something it’s not a roadblock — you passionately seek answers and solutions without being told to.

We want to talk to you if you are proficient (or willing to learn) in:

  • PHP / Laravel
  • VueJS
  • API engineering
  • CMS experience (Craft, Statamic) a plus
  • Other JS frameworks (i.e. React, Node) a plus
  • Technical architecture
  • Automated deployment & testing systems
  • Experience in exploratory tech (WebVR, WebGL, Facebook Bots, Alexa voice apps) a plus

Other Details 

  • Zaengle is a 100% remote team spanning the US and UK
  • Compensation is very competitive, paid holidays, flexible paid time off, healthcare benefits offered
  • Additional perks include profit sharing, semi-annual "ZaengleCon" events, and conferences
  • This role reports to our Lead Engineer
  • As we seek to live out "Be Nice, Do Good" we also provide time / budget for our team members to give back to their communities and underprivileged people groups

How to Apply

Send us samples of your work — live examples, link to your GitHub profile, CodePen, or whatever else. In addition, we’d love to hear about challenges you faced, obstacles overcome, or reasoning behind the decisions you made. Give us a glimpse into your process!
  1. Link to a blog post, article you’ve written, or presentation you’ve given in the past year on any topic.
  2. What is one cause, organization, global challenge, or initiative you’re most passionate about?
  3. Mention "Aardvark" in your response.
  4. What is one challenge you've faced (in work, life, anything!) and how did you overcome it?
Send everything to: jobs@zaengle.com
NO RECRUITERS OR AGENCIES PLEASE AND THANK YOU.

items.content:
Senior Web Developer

Company: Reaktiv Studios
Headquarters: Temecula, CA
Visit company website

Join our team and help bring our clients’ biggest ideas to light.
 
Reaktiv is actively searching for a Web or Senior Web Developer to join our remote team. Does this sound like you?

  • You're dedicated to developing your skills as part of a highly collaborative team
  • You're committed to building, maintaining, supporting, and refactoring web sites and content management systems (with a focus on WordPress)
  • You possess a high level understanding of PHP and JavaScript, and are proficient in SQL, HTML5, CSS and CSS preprocessors
  • You love participating in positive and collaborative peer code reviews
  • You are comfortable with the communication tools and skills required to work effectively with a distributed team (like Slack, Asana, and Zoom. Patience and understanding go a long way too)
  • You are familiar with automated deployment workflows and Git or similar version control tools

Senior candidates should also have the following:

  • You embrace your curious nature by approaching new and complex problems with gusto, and continuously seek out opportunities to grow
  • You are kind, patient and respectful in your communication with clients and comfortable guiding them to their desired result
  • You strive to improve and document the team’s workflow and processes
  • You excel at auditing sites for performance, security and future maintainability as well as providing recommendations for improvement

What is it like to work at Reaktiv?

We're a close-knit, fully distributed team who enjoy the challenge of solving hard problems together with clients like Atlassian, Cornell University, Harvard Business School, The New York Times Company, Tribune Media, and Wirecutter. We're also one of the few WordPress.com VIP agency partners in the world.

We are a 100% remote company where each employee works from home or a co-working space. Even though we're far away, we're in contact throughout the day in Slack, Asana and Zoom.

We encourage continual education through weekly lunch and learns and taking courses to keep us ahead of the latest advancements. Our team also enjoys getting out from behind their desks and attending WordCamps and conferences across the country. We're frequent WordCamp speakers and core contributors.

While we may work hard Monday through Friday we prioritize a healthy work-life balance. Our off hours are reserved for practicing trapeze, playing guitar, and spending time with our families.
 
We’re proud to offer a generous compensation package that includes:

  • Competitive salary
  • Medical/Dental/Vision
  • 401k with employer match
  • Open PTO policy
  • Paid parental leave
  • Flexible schedule
  • Equipment budget
  • Conference and continued education budget
  • Annual team retreats

Ready to apply?

U.S. citizenship required, and please, no recruiters.

Please fill out the form and provide a link in your cover letter to two work samples, along with a description of each and why it demonstrates your expertise.
 
Reaktiv is committed to equal opportunities, diversity, and inclusion
Reaktiv Studios, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We don’t discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences that people imagine to discriminate against one another.
If you have a disability, please let us know if there’s anything we can do to make the application and interview process more comfortable and accessible for you.

items.content:
Experienced Wordpress Developer - Remote

Company: Leadflare, Inc
Headquarters: New York/UK/Cyprus/India
Visit company website

About us

We're a small team of motivated developers working on a number of very exciting projects that range from general Wordpress development and large Learndash training systems through to complex software development involving 3-D models and predictive analytics. 

We're currently very busy on a big software project and we need a capable Wordpress developer to join the team to help look after all of the Wordpress development that is always underway. 

About the job

This is a full-time position, and as well as programming Wordpress, your typical working week might also include liaising with clients about new Wordpress implementations that need to be delivered; liaising with our design teams about the functional requirements of their designs; and liaising with the rest of us about how to make this particular implementation as amazing as possible. 

About the compensation

This position will start out on a rolling monthly contract for a three-month trial period. It has the potential to become a full-time position for the right person. We believe in paying well for the right skills and commitment. 

Who we're looking for

##Qualifications:
- 5+ years of Wordpress development experience
- HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, and jQuery
- Strong understanding of PHP back-end development
- Good communicator, fluent in English
- Fun personality that enjoys working with others
- Bonus points for published plugins
- Bonus points for having worked on Learndash

##Responsibilities:
- Work remotely with flexible hours - EU time zone preferred
- Meet deadlines consistently
- Write beautiful clean code including custom plugins and themes
- Ensure consistent style across platforms and browsers

Next steps

If you think you're the person for the job, please send us your resume plus a covering letter that gives us more insight into who you are. Tell us something interesting! If you have questions, please also include them in your cover letter. 

If we feel like you're a good match, we'll set up a screening call to discuss further. 

We look forward to hearing from you.

items.title: Full-Time Remote WordPress Blogger
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=40, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Full-Time Remote WordPress Blogger

Company: WordCandy
Location: Remote
Job Type: Contract

Description

Do you have a passion for the written word and professional writing experience?

Are you highly computer literate, and already familiar with the WordPress content management system?

If you’re nodding your head in agreement with the above questions, you could be our perfect candidate. As a full-time WordPress blogger for WordCandy, you will be responsible for:

  • Keeping up to speed with the latest developments in the self-hosted WordPress community.
  • Experimenting with new WordPress features, themes, and plugins, as well as related products and services.
  • Creating unique and engaging WordPress-related topic ideas.
  • Crafting superb quality WordPress-related blog posts for some of the biggest WordPress blogs on the web, such as Elegant Themes and ThemeIsle.

We will expect the following from you:

  • Solid writing skills. You have a few years’ professional writing experience under your belt (ideally including blogging), and are passionate about writing for a living.
  • Computer literacy. You’ve been using computers for as long as you can remember, and find it easy to pick up new things. You might not know WordPress in-depth (yet), but you’re confident that you’ll pick it up quickly.
  • Attention to detail.You consider yourself a perfectionist, and having the time available to create high-quality work is important to you.
  • Passion for learning.You love the idea of diving into a role where you’ll learn new things every day, and value constructive criticism as a means of boosting your skills and experience.
  • A love for remote working.You value the flexibility and autonomy of a remote working arrangement and ideally have experience working under your own impetus.

Here are the key details of the role:

  • Starting rate of $15 per hour.
  • 7.5 hours per day, Monday–Friday.

Note that this is a contractor (rather than employee) position. You will work remotely from wherever you please, and as much as practically possible, we accommodate flexible working hours agreed up front.

WordCandy is a fast-growing business formed in 2011 when its founder, Tom Ewer, started writing blog posts for WordPress-related publications on the web. It has since grown (so far) to a team of four full-time and many part-time contractors producing over 150,000 words per month for various WordPress-related clients.

If you’re interested in the role, please submit your application at WordCandy.co!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=30, embedded=0, frontend=21}
items.content:
Full Stack Web Developer

United Kingdom, London
Company: The Jefferson Group

Job Summary

London, United Kingdom

Not Specified

Our client is looking for an ambitious and capable full stack web developer with front end experience and knowledge of WordPress, HTML and JavaScript to work alongside their creative team.

They are a fully integrated, global B2B marketing agency with offices around the world. They’re home to some of the world’s leading tech brands, they deliver award-winning campaigns and create content designed to turn heads and stand out in a crowded market place. They’re passionately creative, dynamic and fun, with an open and honest environment and a flat structure that encourages employee growth in-line with the agency’s ambitious expansion plans.

The role will take head-turning creative and build marketing content for use across clients’ campaigns and websites. Content will vary from responsive HTML emails and animated banner ads to full-scale web builds, primarily using the Vue.JS framework. There will also be responsibility for maintaining legacy builds, often built on the WordPress PHP framework.

The agency’s own website will also require ongoing maintenance and updates to ensure business operations and communications are developed and executed to the highest standards.

You’ll need to have two- or three-years’ experience working as a developer, ideally within an agency environment. You’ll have worked with JavaScript, Vue.JS (or similar), CSS and Greensock. Ideally, you’ll also have experience of MySQL, you’ll have built HTML emails and banner ads, you will have worked with WordPress and PHP and your skills will extend to PLESK Administration Panel and basic Linux Administration.

Critically, you’ll be a strong communicator, confident, articulate and able to work with people across the agency. This role calls for commercial dev experience and a good understanding of life within a busy, dynamic marketing agency working with major global brands.

In return, our client is offering a competitive salary up to £35k p/a, plus a great benefits package.

If this sounds like the next step in your career, get in touch with me, Mark Davies, by applying below.

items.content:
Drupal Developer With React Experience

Accella

 US-only

This position is for US residents only.

Accella is looking for a developer with experience building websites and modules in Drupal. The candidate will need to show an expertise in Drupal development that goes deeper than basic theming and should have experience building custom modules and integrating with third party applications and services.

In addition to Drupal experience, we are looking for a candidate with a mixed skillset, including experience with React, React Native, or other JavaScript libraries. While the position will be Drupal focused, it is likely the candidate will be asked to work on projects ranging from web to mobile, so we are looking for a more well-rounded individual in terms of a technology background.

We will heavily weigh the applicants problem solving skills. Must be highly motivated and a serious self starter.

Must have the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical resources. We are looking for someone that enjoys being part of a team and will offer feedback and ideas in order to design and develop the most solid and extensible products for our clients.

We want a leader, an ideas person, and someone that is eager to work on multiple challenging projects, sometimes simultaneously.

What we expect in a candidate: 

- BS in Computer Science, BS in closely related discipline or equivalent industry experience

- Candidate must be located within the US, but can be located anywhere around the country

- 3+ years experience with Drupal development including experience with Drupal 8

- At least 5 years experience with software development

- At least 1 year experience with React or other JavaScript technologies

- Effective communication skills (written and oral)

- Problem-solving and creative mindset

- Experience thriving in a high-performance, results-oriented organization

- Experience and proficiency in interacting with external clients

- Experience with Ruby on Rails a plus

- Experience with native mobile development a plus

#Location
- US-only
